page.title: 13Wildlife
page.content: Our area is mainly housing and open fields except for{Holywell Dene}which is a wooded area following the course of the Seaton Burn in an East/West direction. In the Dene there are the remains of some buildings known as 'Gowden's Hole'. The Northumberland Wildlife Trust look after 3{ponds}in our area and we were given special permission to visit one of them and work there. We found many interesting creatures and found them even more interesting under the microscope. We pressed flowers, identified and labelled them. We all feel that{ {conservation}is very important to protect our environment. Mr. Manchee of the County Planning Dept. explained the importance of planting the right kind of trees to encourage wildlife. We have been able to adopt a piece of woodland and care for it.
